intro: Salaxis brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved salaxis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are narrow and short, giving it its common name. Salaxis brevifolia is often found in moist, wooded areas and is adapted to thrive in partial shade.
